titleStmt.title: Strange and terrible nevves from the North. Concerning the Northern great storm arose in the those parts, to the great amazement of all the inhabitants within the realme of England, and the great slaughter of divers poore harmlesse creatures. With, an exact relation of the late fight, and the manner of obtaining the victory by the Royalists party, and the full particulars thereof. Also, another fight in the West of England, betwixt the Parliaments forces, and the rebels in South-Wales, and the gallant successe and proceedings of the forces commanded by Colonel Horton, Colonel Lewis, Captain Jones, Captain Reade. and Captain Griffith.
titleStmt.author: R. S.
Strange, fl. 1648.
Davis, T.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for R.G. and are to be sold neere Temple-Barre,

notesStmt.note: Contains four letters all dated and signed: The first: Carmarthen 13. April 1648. T. Davis.; the second: Sandhill Aprill 15. 1648. Strange; the third: Barwick 16 April, 1648. R.S.; the fourth: Carmarthen 15. April 1648. T.D.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
